summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida to attorney Brad Edwards, notifying him that his client (a victim) must be informed that Jeffrey Epstein has been granted work release from the Palm Beach County Stockade. The letter reveals the U.S. Attorney's Office was not notified of Epstein's application and only learned of his release over six weeks after it began.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein begins work release program
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein applies for and is granted participation in the Palm Beach County Sheriff's Office work release program, working for The Florida Science Foundation while electronically monitored and returning daily to the stockade.

locations: 250 South Australian Avenue, Suite 1404, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was granted participation in the Palm Beach County Sheriff's Office work release program, allowing him to leave the stockade for work.
Epstein was reportedly working for The Florida Science Foundation in West Palm Beach while electronically monitored via GPS and an ankle bracelet.
The U.S. Attorney's Office was not notified of Epstein's work release application and only learned of his release more than six weeks after it began.
The letter is signed by R. Alexander Acosta, the United States Attorney for the Southern District of Florida, indicating his direct involvement in the Epstein case at this stage.
